Geographic origin: Woodwardville, Anne Arundel County, Maryland, United States
Notes on original: Kieffer pears injured by frost, 04/24/1905, after they were set. These Kieffer pears were full set, nearly 1/2 inch in diameter and were frozen through and through. Injured most on the inside, the ovules being all dead. The flesh of the pear was partly killed and ruptured. The stamens and leaves were not hurt but all such fruits dropped off in a few days.
Name: Pyrus communis: Kieffer
